channel.title: JSON item definitions
channel.description:
Example definition: [code]{ "id": 4151, "name": "Abyssal whip", "examine": "A weapon from the Abyss.", "equipmentType": "WEAPON", "noted": false, "noteable": true, "stackable": false, "parentId": -1, "notedId": 4152, "members": true, "specialStorePrice": 120000, "generalStorePrice": 120000, "highAlchValue": 72000, "lowAlchValue": 48000, "weight": 0.5, "bonuses": [ 0, 82, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 82, 0 ] }[/code]
Download: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/download/ji7g55o31898y7r/item-definitions.json]item-definitions.json[/url]

item.title: JSON item definitions
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:2, topic:526521”]It says your closing bracket is malformed, though I honestly don’t see anything wrong with it.
When I change my BufferedReader to JsonReader it ignores it but then I can’t store my data to a list
Any idea?[/quote]

you must set the lenient boolean in the JsonReader to true.

there’s going to be some problems reading some of the item examinations, but you can easily fix that by taking the quotation marks out of the actual examine.

Read full topic

item.title: JSON item definitions
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

It says your closing bracket is malformed, though I honestly don’t see anything wrong with it.

Any idea?
